metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7525 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A deserialization flaw was discovered in the jackson-databind, versions before 2.6.7.1, 2.7.9.1 and 2.8.9, which could allow an unauthenticated user to perform code execution by sending the maliciously crafted input to the readValue method of the ObjectMapper. It was discovered that Jackson Databind incorrectly handled deserialization. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7525` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libjackson2-databind-java - 2.4.2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

libjackson-json-java - 1.9.2-7ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: jackson-databind package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.2-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
libjackson-json-java package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.2-7ubuntu0.2').
